Contacts documentation¶

Service Users¶

class src.services.users.UserService(db: AsyncSession)¶

Bases: object

Service layer for handling user-related operations such as user creation, fetching users by different attributes (ID, username, email), and updating the user’s avatar URL.

repository¶

The repository used for database operations related to users.

Type:

UserRepository

async confirmed_email(email: str)¶

Marks the email address as confirmed in the database.

Parameters:

email (str) – The email address to confirm.

Returns:

The user object with the updated confirmation status.

Return type:

User

async create_user(body: UserCreate)¶

Creates a new user with the provided user data and attempts to fetch a Gravatar image using the user’s email.

If Gravatar fetch fails, the avatar is set to None.

Parameters:

body (UserCreate) – The user data used for creating the new user.

Returns:

The created user object with the associated avatar URL (if available).

Return type:

User

async get_user_by_email(email: str)¶

Fetches a user by their email.

Parameters:

email (str) – The email of the user to retrieve.

Returns:

The user object, if found, else None.

Return type:

User

async get_user_by_id(user_id: int)¶

Fetches a user by their ID.

Parameters:

user_id (int) – The ID of the user to retrieve.

Returns:

The user object, if found, else None.

Return type:

User

async get_user_by_username(username: str)¶

Fetches a user by their username.

Parameters:

username (str) – The username of the user to retrieve.

Returns:

The user object, if found, else None.

Return type:

User

async update_avatar_url(email: str, url: str)¶

Updates the avatar URL of a user identified by their email.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email of the user whose avatar needs to be updated.

  • url (str) – The new avatar URL to associate with the user.

Returns:

The user object with the updated avatar URL.

Return type:

User

Service Upload File¶

class src.services.upload_file.UploadFileService(cloud_name: str, api_key: str, api_secret: str)¶

Bases: object

Service class for handling file uploads to Cloudinary.

This class provides functionality to upload files to Cloudinary, configure the Cloudinary instance with provided credentials, and generate a URL for the uploaded image with custom settings.

cloud_name¶

The Cloudinary cloud name for the account.

Type:

str

api_key¶

The API key for accessing Cloudinary services.

Type:

str

api_secret¶

The API secret for accessing Cloudinary services.

Type:

str

static upload_file(file, username: str) → str¶

Uploads a file to Cloudinary and generates a URL for the uploaded file with custom settings.

The file is uploaded with a public ID based on the username, and the generated URL is cropped and resized to a 250x250 square image.

Parameters:

  • file – The file to upload. This should be a file-like object (e.g., an image file).

  • username (str) – The username to use for naming the file’s public ID.

Returns:

The URL of the uploaded image, resized to 250x250 with “fill” crop mode.

Return type:

str

Service Contacts¶

class src.services.contacts.ContactService(db: AsyncSession)¶

Bases: object

Service class for handling contact-related business logic.

Provides methods to create, read, update, delete, and search contacts. Handles validation and integrity errors during these operations.

async create_contact(body: ContactModel, user: User)¶

Creates a new contact.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – The contact information to be created.

  • user (User) – The user creating the contact.

Returns:

The created contact.

Return type:

ContactModel

Raises:

HTTPException – If there is an integrity error (e.g., duplicate email or phone number).

async get_contact(contact_id: int, user: User)¶

Retrieves a single contact by its ID for the specified user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • user (User) – The user requesting the contact.

Returns:

The requested contact, if found.

Return type:

ContactModel

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact does not belong to the user or is not found.

async get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, user: User)¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for the specified user, with pagination.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of records to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of records to retrieve.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[ContactModel]

async get_contacts_upcoming_birthday(user: User)¶

Retrieves a list of contacts with upcoming birthdays for the specified user.

Parameters:

user (User) – The user requesting the list of contacts.

Returns:

A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

List[ContactModel]

async remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User)¶

Deletes a contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to remove.

  • user (User) – The user requesting the deletion.

Returns:

The deleted contact.

Return type:

ContactModel

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact does not belong to the user or is not found.

async search_contacts(user: User, first_name: str = None, last_name: str = None, email: str = None)¶

Searches for contacts based on provided filters.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user performing the search.

  • first_name (str, optional) – The first name to search for.

  • last_name (str, optional) – The last name to search for.

  • email (str, optional) – The email to search for.

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the search criteria.

Return type:

List[ContactModel]

async update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdate, user: User)¶

Updates the details of an existing contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • body (ContactUpdate) – The updated contact information.

  • user (User) – The user updating the contact.

Returns:

The updated contact.

Return type:

ContactModel

Raises:

HTTPException – If there is an integrity error (e.g., duplicate email or phone number).

Repository Contacts¶

class src.repository.contacts.ContactRepository(session: AsyncSession)¶

Bases: object

async create_contact(body: ContactModel, user: User) → Contact¶

Create a new contact for the specified user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – The data model for the new contact.

  • user (User) – The owner of the new contact.

Returns:

The created contact.

Return type:

Contact

async get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int, user: User) → Contact | None¶

Get a contact by its ID for the specified user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact.

  • user (User) – The owner of the contact.

Returns:

The contact if found, or None if not.

Return type:

Contact | None

async get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, user: User) → Sequence[Contact]¶

Get a list of contacts owned by user with pagination.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • user (User) – The owner of the contacts to retrieve.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

Sequence[Contact]

async get_contacts_upcoming_birthday(user: User) → Sequence[Contact]¶

Get contacts of the specified user who have birthdays within the next week.

Parameters:

user (User) – The owner of the contacts.

Returns:

A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

Sequence[Contact]

async remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User) → Contact | None¶

Remove a contact for the specified user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to remove.

  • user (User) – The owner of the contact.

Returns:

The removed contact, or None if not found.

Return type:

Contact | None

async search_contacts(user: User, first_name: str = None, last_name: str = None, email: str = None) → Sequence[Contact]¶

Search for contacts by first name, last name, or email for the specified user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The owner of the contacts.

  • first_name (str, optional) – The first name to search for.

  • last_name (str, optional) – The last name to search for.

  • email (str, optional) – The email to search for.

Returns:

A list of matching contacts.

Return type:

Sequence[Contact]

async update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdate, user: User) → Contact | None¶

Update a contact for the specified user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • body (ContactUpdate) – The new data to update the contact.

  • user (User) – The owner of the contact.

Returns:

The updated contact, or None if not found.

Return type:

Contact | None

Repository Users¶

class src.repository.users.UserRepository(session: AsyncSession)¶

Bases: object

async confirmed_email(email: str) → None¶

Confirm a user’s email address.

Parameters:

email (str) – The email address of the user to confirm.

async create_user(body: UserCreate, avatar: str = None) → User¶

Create a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body (UserCreate) – The data model containing user information (excluding password).

  • avatar (str, optional) – The avatar URL for the user. Defaults to None.

Returns:

The created user object with all fields populated.

Return type:

User

async get_user_by_email(email: str) → User | None¶

Retrieve a user by their email.

Parameters:

email (str) – The email of the user to retrieve.

Returns:

The user if found, otherwise None.

Return type:

User | None

Parameters:

user_id (int) – The ID of the user to retrieve.

Returns:

The user if found, otherwise None.

Return type:

User | None

async get_user_by_username(username: str) → User | None¶

Retrieve a user by their username.

Parameters:

username (str) – The username of the user to retrieve.

Returns:

The user if found, otherwise None.

Return type:

User | None

async update_avatar_url(email: str, url: str) → User¶

Update the avatar URL for an existing user.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user whose avatar URL is being updated.

  • url (str) – The new avatar URL.

Returns:

The updated user object with the new avatar URL.

Return type:

User
